test: hehindu.com football fifa world cup news fifa world cup quickest goal scorer qatar 2022 wc messi record soccer news article66171596.ece.  Goodwin of Australia scores the fastest goal of FIFA World Cup 2022, breaks record of Messi - Sportstar  Magazine Posters Columns Special Editions Sportstar Conclave  Kolkata-2023  Badminton Tennis Cricket  WPL 2023 India International Domestic Cricket Videos  Football  Fifa World Cup ISL 2022-23 Premier League International La-Liga Bundesliga UEFA Champions League Europa League India Transfers Football Videos  Videos Podcasts More Sports  Volleyball Basketball Kabaddi Chess Wrestling Motorsport Squash Athletics Archery Shooting Golf Boxing  ACES 2023 Subscribe NowSign In Magazine Posters Columns Special Editions Sportstar Conclave  Kolkata-2023  Badminton Tennis Cricket  WPL 2023 India International Domestic Cricket Videos  Football  Fifa World Cup ISL 2022-23 Premier League International La-Liga Bundesliga UEFA Champions League Europa League India Transfers Football Videos  Videos Podcasts More Sports  Volleyball Basketball Kabaddi Chess Wrestling Motorsport Squash Athletics Archery Shooting Golf Boxing  ACES 2023 News Goodwin of Australia scores the fastest goal of FIFA World Cup 2022, breaks record of Messi Craig Goodwin of Australia scored the first goal against France in the ninth minute, breaking the record of Lionel Messi, to become the quickest goal scorer in the FIFA World Cup 2022. Team Sportstar 23 November, 2022 00:50 IST 23 November, 2022 00:50 IST Australia‚Äôs Craig Goodwin celebrates scoring their first goal. | Photo Credit: REUTERS Craig Goodwin of Australia scored the first goal against France in the ninth minute, breaking the record of Lionel Messi, to become the quickest goal scorer in the FIFA World Cup 2022. Craig Goodwin of Australia scored the first goal against France in the ninth minute, breaking the record of Lionel Messi, to become the quickest goal scorer in the FIFA World Cup 2022.Starting against defending champion France, the Socceroos stunned Les Blues with an early goal as Goodwin made a clam finish, beating Hugo Lloris.Also ReadFrance 4-1 Australia HIGHLIGHTS, FIFA World Cup: Giroud brace, Mbappe, Rabiot goals give Les Blue winning startHe beat the record of Lionel Messi, who scored from the spot also in the ninth minute, but in terms of seconds, it was the Australian, who beat Messi.It was the quickest goal against France at the World Cup since Bryan Robson in 1982 (00:27) as he became the first Australian to score a World Cup non-penalty goal since Tim Cahill against the Netherlands in 2014.The FIFA World Cup 2022 would have seen an earlier goal in the opening fixture when Ecuador‚Äôs Enner Valencia had headed the ball into the net in the third minute. However, after a VAR check, the goal was ruled offside.Earlier today, Lionel Messi had scored from the spot against Saudi Arabia, but Argentina was eventually stunned with Saudi Arabia beating it 2-1 at the Lusail Stadium.Is this one of the fastest-ever World Cup goal?No. The quickest goal in the FIFA World Cup was scored by Turkey‚Äôs Hakan Suker, who took just 11 seconds to find the net. Goodwin‚Äôs goal, however, is much later than the top five fastest goals, all of which were score on or before 30 seconds of kick-off.What was the quickest goal of the previous World Cup?The 2018 FIFA World Cup saw Denmark‚Äôs Mathias Jorgensen score against Croatia in the 58th second, which became the fastest goal in the previous edition of the tournament. ‚¶øCheck out Sportstar‚Äôs coverage of World Cup in Qatar ‚¶øScan the World Cup in pictures ‚¶øFootball fans, put your skills to the test with FIFA World Cup Quiz ‚¶øSoak in the rich history of the football World Cup ‚¶øWATCH: What‚Äôs happening in Qatar and who is saying what ‚¶øHere are some of the most frequently asked questionsFIFA World Cup latest talking points:Saudi Arabia shocks ArgentinaIt looked like Lionel Messi took 10 minutes and a penalty (that silenced a raucous Saudi crowd behind the team dugouts at the Lusail Stadium) to set sails for yet another World Cup adventure ‚Äì his last ‚Äì to exorcise the ghosts of disappointments past. Argentina led by Lionel Messi started its World Cup campaign with a loss to Saudi Arabia. | Photo Credit: AFP But his sails lost their wind in five terrifying second-half minutes, handing Argentina a 2-1 opening-game ambush by Saudi Arabia to give him and his mates a new nightmare.Full story here: Saudi Arabia stuns Argentina to dent Messi‚Äôs World Cup ambitionsCan Argentina can qualify for knockouts after the shock loss?Argentina, considered by many to be among the FIFA World Cup title favourites, began its Qatar 2022 campaign with a shock 2-1 loss to Saudi Arabia on Tuesday. This loss makes the Lionel Messi-led side‚Äôs chances of qualifying from Group C to the round of 16 more difficult. How Argentina can ensure qualification for the knockout stage of the World CupThe South American side next faces Mexico on November 27 and then takes on Poland on December 1. Argentina needs to win both these games to give itself the best chance for qualification. Two wins would put it at six points, which could ensure a top spot depending on other results.Full scenarios here: How Argentina can qualify for knockouts after shock loss to Saudi ArabiaWhy was Ecuador goal ruled offside by VAR?The first goal by Ecuador in the opening game of the FIFA World Cup against Qatar in the third minute was ruled out after a VAR check, leaving Ecuador fans bamboozled by the decision.Enner Valencia, receiving the ball off a kick by Felix Torres, headed it into the net to the jubilation of thousands of Ecuadorian fans at the Al Bayt Stadium in Qatar.But after consulting the video assistant referees, the goal was ruled out as off-side.Full story here: Explained: FIFA World Cup, Why was Ecuador goal ruled offside by VAR?Why so much injury time is added in Qatar WC?One noticeable change in the ongoing Qatar World Cup has been the increase in stoppage time added in each half. In the five matches played so far, there have been a combined total of 90 minutes played -- which is a duration of a football match. The Netherlands‚Äò Davy Klaassen scored in the ninth minute of added time, despite the officials adding eight minutes of injury time. It‚Äôs not so common to see the amount of added time in World Cup matches as seen in this edition.Why is it so? Read here: FIFA World Cup 2022: Why is so much injury time added in Qatar WC?Read more stories on News. For more updates, follow Sportstar on : Lionel MessiAustralia/Socceroos ¬†Pen, Paper and Podcast with Vijay Lokapally Videos WATCH: Messi hometown Rosario ready for FIFA World Cup final, Argentina vs France France‚Äôs road to Fifa World Cup 2022 final vs Argentina How will Scaloni‚Äôs Argentina line up for FIFA World Cup campaign opener vs Argentina? fname: hehindu.com football fifa world cup news fifa world cup qatar 2022 eight stadiums venues guide opening ceremony final article66160572.ece
test: hehindu.com football fifa world cup news fifa world cup qatar 2022 eight stadiums venues guide opening ceremony final article66160572.ece.  FIFA World Cup: All you need to know about Qatar 2022 stadiums - Sportstar  Magazine Posters Columns Special Editions Sportstar Conclave  Kolkata-2023  Badminton Tennis Cricket  WPL 2023 India International Domestic Cricket Videos  Football  Fifa World Cup ISL 2022-23 Premier League International La-Liga Bundesliga UEFA Champions League Europa League India Transfers Football Videos  Videos Podcasts More Sports  Volleyball Basketball Kabaddi Chess Wrestling Motorsport Squash Athletics Archery Shooting Golf Boxing  ACES 2023 Subscribe NowSign In Magazine Posters Columns Special Editions Sportstar Conclave  Kolkata-2023  Badminton Tennis Cricket  WPL 2023 India International Domestic Cricket Videos  Football  Fifa World Cup ISL 2022-23 Premier League International La-Liga Bundesliga UEFA Champions League Europa League India Transfers Football Videos  Videos Podcasts More Sports  Volleyball Basketball Kabaddi Chess Wrestling Motorsport Squash Athletics Archery Shooting Golf Boxing  ACES 2023 News FIFA World Cup: All you need to know about Qatar 2022 stadiums Here is all you need to know about all the eight stadiums hosting the FIFA World Cup matches in Qatar. 20 November, 2022 20:20 IST 20 November, 2022 20:20 IST The ‚Äò974‚Äô in Stadium 974 signifies Qatar‚Äôs international dialing code and is also the exact number of recycled shipping containers used to construct the arena. | Photo Credit: Getty Images Here is all you need to know about all the eight stadiums hosting the FIFA World Cup matches in Qatar. The Middle-Eastern country of Qatar is all geared up to host the FIFA World Cup starting from December 20. How many stadiums are being used in FIFA World Cup 2022? Returning to Asia after two decades, the marquee event will be played in eight coming-of-age stadiums across Qatar. Al Bayt stadium, located in the northeastern coastal city of Al Khor, will host the opening ceremony and the campaign opener between the host and Ecuador. Lusail, the largest of all the venues, will host the final. It has a seating capacity of 80,000.32 teams, divided into eight groups, will battle it out for the most sought after artifact in the footballing world - the FIFA World Cup trophy. Stadium 974 The ‚Äò974‚Äô in stadium 974 signifies the number of recycled containers used to build the stadium. | Photo Credit: Getty Images The ‚Äò974‚Äô in Stadium 974 signifies Qatar‚Äôs international dialing code and is also the exact number of recycled shipping containers used to construct the arena, making it the first ever fully demountable stadium in the history of World Cups.¬†With a seating capacity of 40,000, the stadium is set to conduct six group-stage games and one round of 16 knockout fixture. The stadium was initially announced under the name Ras Abu Aboud Stadium.The stadium was presented during a digital launch in November last year and held its inaugural game on the first day of the FIFA Arab Cup on November 30, 2021, when the United Arab Emirates played Syria.¬†After the World Cup, there is a possibility that the containers will be dismantled, transported, and rebuilt in Maldonado, Uruguay, to host matches for the 2030 FIFA World Cup if Uruguay‚Äôs bid is successful.Matches:¬†22 November - Group C: Mexico vs Poland¬†24 November - Group H: Portugal vs Ghana¬†26 November - Group D: France vs Denmark¬†28 November - Group G: Brazil vs Switzerland¬†30 November - Group H: Poland vs Argentina¬†02 December - Group G: Serbia vs Switzerland05 December - Round of 16: 1G vs 2H Al Bayt Stadium Once the tournament is completed, the upper tier of this stadium will be dismantled and the seats will be used for various purposes at the training facilities in the venue.¬† | Photo Credit: REUTERS The stadium, with a capacity of 60,000, was inaugurated on November 30, 2021 during the FIFA Arab Cup.¬†The architects of this venue have drawn inspiration from tents that were used by ancient nomads in the Middle East.¬†Apart from hosting the opening ceremony and the first game, the stadium will also host a round-of-16 game, quarterfinal, and one semifinal fixture.¬†Once the tournament is completed, the upper tier of this stadium will be dismantled and the seats will be used for various purposes at the training facilities in the venue. The government is also planning to incorporate a sports medicine hospital within the premises in the future.Matches:¬†20 November¬†- Group A: Qatar vs Ecuador23 November¬†- Group F: Morocco vs Senegal¬†25 November¬†- Group B: England vs USA¬†27 November¬†- Group E: Spain vs Germany¬†29 November¬†- Group A: Netherlands vs Qatar¬†1 December¬†- Group E: Costa Rica vs Germany¬†4 December¬†- Round of 16: 1B vs 2A¬†10 December¬†- Quarterfinal¬†14 December¬†- Semifinal Khalifa International Stadium A general view of the Khalifa International Stadium in Doha, Qatar. | Photo Credit: AP Built in 1976, this is the oldest among all the stadiums in Qatar. The Khalifa International stadium has hosted an array of events in the past like the AFC Asian Cup, Asian Games, and the Arabian Gulf Cup to name a few. In 2019, it hosted the IAAF World Athletics Championships and the FIFA Club World Cup.¬†Gearing up for the World Cup, the stadium underwent extensive changes which resulted in more than 10,000 seats being added to the stands, bumping up the capacity to 40,000.¬†The opening match in this venue will be between England and Iran on November 21. It will also host five more group stage matches, a round-of-16 match, and the playoff for third place.¬†Matches:¬†21 November - Group B: England vs Iran23 November - Group E: Germany vs Japan¬†25 November - Group A: Netherlands vs Ecuador¬†27 November - Group F: Croatia vs Canada¬†29 November - Group A: Ecuador vs Senegal1 December - Group E: Japan vs Spain¬†3 December - Round of 16: 1A vs 2B¬†17 December - 3rd Place Al Thumama Stadium Meeting the minimum requirement for a World Cup venue‚Äôs capacity, the Al Thumama stadium can accommodate up to 40,000 fans.¬† | Photo Credit: REUTERS Inaugurated to the public when it hosted the Amir Cup final between Al Sadd, formerly managed by Xavi, and Al Rayyan in 2021, Al Thumama stadium is a fairly new venue and was constructed specifically for the World Cup.The stadium, which was built inspired by the Ghafiya, a traditional woven cap worn by men and boys throughout the Middle East, will host six group-stage matches, as well as a Round of 16 match and one quarterfinal.Meeting the minimum requirement for a World Cup venue‚Äôs capacity, the stadium can accommodate up to 40,000 fans. Air-conditioning vents have been placed throughout the stadium, as with all other Qatar venues, to maintain an optimal temperature inside.¬†At the end of the World Cup, the stadium‚Äôs capacity will be reduced to 20,000 seats with the additional seating being gifted to developing nations.Matches:¬†21 November¬†- Group A: Senegal vs Netherlands¬†23 November - Group E: Spain vs Costa Rica¬†25 November¬†- Group A: Qatar vsSenegal¬†27 November¬†- Group F: Belgium vs Morocco¬†29 November¬†- Group B: Iran vs USA¬†1 December¬†- Group F: Canada vs Morocco¬†4 December -¬† Round of 16: 1D vs 2C¬†10 December¬†- Quarterfinal Lusail Stadium Lusail stadium is the largest venue in this edition‚Äôs World Cup and will host the final. | Photo Credit: REUTERS Lusail Stadium will host the World Cup 2022 final along with matches from the group stage, round of 16, a quarterfinal and a semifinal.¬†According to the tournament website, the stadium is customised on the lines of the traditional fanar‚Äôs (lantern) dance of light and shadow, showcasing the rich Arabic heritage.¬†The stadium is situated 15 kilometers north of Doha‚Äôs city center and stands as the center of attraction of the new Lusail metropolitan city. After the tournament, the Lusail Stadium will be transformed into a community space with schools, shops, sporting facilities, and health clinics.Lusail Stadium ‚Äì the centrepiece venue of the World Cup ‚Äì was inaugurated when it played host to the Lusail Super Cup final between Saudi Pro League champion, Al Hilal SFC, and the Egyptian Premier League winner, Zamalek on September 9.¬†Matches:¬†22 November - Group C: Argentina vs Saudi Arabia¬†24 November - Group G: Brazil vs Serbia¬†26 November - Group C: Argentina vs Mexico¬†28 November - Group H: Portugal vs Uruguay¬†30 November - Group C: Saudi Arabia vs Mexico¬†2 December - Group G: Cameroon vs Brazil¬†5 December - Round of 16: 1H vs 2G¬†9 December - Quarterfinal13 December - Semifinal¬†18 December - Final Education City Stadium Once the World Cup concludes, the stadium‚Äôs capacity will be reduced to 25,000 and the remaining seats will be donated to developing countries.¬† | Photo Credit: AP Inspired by the geometric shapes which resemble traditional Islamic architecture, the venue is surrounded by several leading universities and hence the name - Education City Stadium.¬†The arena is set to host six group-stage matches along with a Round of 16 game and one quarterfinal and has a 40,000 seating capacity.¬†The stadium, known as ‚ÄúDiamond in the Desert,‚Äù is situated outside Doha, the country‚Äôs capital. In June 2020, the stadium was formally unveiled as part of a virtual ceremony, honouring those who provided front-line healthcare during the coronavirus outbreak.¬†Once the World Cup concludes, the venue‚Äôs capacity will be reduced to 25,000 and the remaining seats will be donated to developing countries.¬†Matches:¬†22 November¬†- Group D: Denmark vs Tunisia¬†24 November¬†- Group H: Uruguay vs Korea Republic¬†26 November¬†- Group C: Poland vs Saudi Arabia128 November¬†- Group H: Korea Republic vs Ghana¬†30 November¬†- Group D: Tunisia vs France¬†2 December¬†- Group H: Korea Republic vs Portugal¬†6 December¬†- Round of 16: 1F vs 2E¬†6 December¬†- QuarterfinalAl Janoub Stadium The stadium will become Qatar Star League side Al Wakrah‚Äôs home venue once the World Cup gets over. | Photo Credit: REUTERS The 40,000-seat Al Janoub Stadium, formerly known as Al Wakrah stadium, is located in one of Qatar‚Äôs oldest settlements and boasts a design that was inspired by the sails of traditional dhow boats as a tribute to the city of Al Wakrah.¬†The stadium was scheduled to be completed in the last quarter of 2018, but some delays pushed that back to 2019. Al Janoub Stadium officially opened on May 16, 2019, with a match between Al-Duhail and Al-Sadd. The arena is all set to host six group-stage matches,¬†a round-of-16 match, and one quarterfinal.The venue‚Äôs tournament capacity (40,000) will be reduced to 20,000 to meet local needs and provide sporting infrastructure to developing nations. To combat Qatar‚Äôs high heat, mechanical cooling systems have been installed in addition to a one-of-a-kind, completely retractable roof.¬†The stadium, once the World Cup comes to a close, will be the home ground for Qatar‚Äôs Star League side Al Wakrah, which currently sits second in the points table.¬†Matches:¬†22 November¬† Group D: France vs Australia24 November¬† Group G: Switzerland vs Cameroon¬†26 November¬† Group D: Tunisia vs Australia28 November¬† Group G: Cameroon vs Serbia¬†30 November¬† Group D: Australia vs Denmark¬†1 December¬† Group H: Ghana vs Uruguay¬†5 December Round of 16: 1E vs 2F¬† Ahmad Bin Ali Stadium Ahmad Bin Ali stadium has a seating capacity of 40,000 and will host six matches. | Photo Credit: REUTERS Home for Qatar‚Äôs Star League football team Al Rayyan once the World Cup gets over, Ahmad Bin Ali stadium, was inaugurated on December 18, 2020, when it hosted the Amir Cup final.¬†With an adequate 40,000 seating capacity, the venue will host six matches in the group stage and one in the round of 16, with the first match happening between The United States and Wales on November 21.¬†After the tournament, half of the stadium‚Äôs seating will be donated to football development projects overseas. The tournament website states that more than 90 per cent of the construction materials have been reused or recycled.¬†Matches:¬†21 November¬†- Group B: USA vs Wales¬†23 November - Group F: Belgium vs Canada25 November¬†- Group B: Wales vs Iran¬†27 November¬†- Group B: Japan vs Costa Rica¬†29 November¬†- Group B: Wales vs England¬†1 December¬†- Group F: Croatia vs Belgium3 December¬†- Round of 16: 1C vs 2DRead more stories on News. For more updates, follow Sportstar on : FIFA World Cup ¬†Pen, Paper and Podcast with Vijay Lokapally Videos WATCH: Messi hometown Rosario ready for FIFA World Cup final, Argentina vs France France‚Äôs road to Fifa World Cup 2022 final vs Argentina How will Scaloni‚Äôs Argentina line up for FIFA World Cup campaign opener vs Argentina? ZidaneFrance national football team's goalscoring chart consists of some of the greatest players in football historyFrance are one of the most decorated national teams around and have produced some of the greatest footballers in history.Zinedine Zidane in his prime was just pure art. Michel Platini was very much a player in the same mould. Just Fontaine is an absolute World Cup legend.And then there were clinical attackers such as Jean-Pierre Papin, David Trezeguet and Thierry Henry.These days, the likes of Karim Benzema, Olivier Giroud, and Kylian Mbappe have taken over the mantle and spend a lot of their time on the pitch celebrating goals.Giroud has latestly surpassed Thierry Henry as France's all-time leading men's scorer by scoring for Les Bleus in the 2022 FIFA World Cup round of 16 match against Poland.But who is France's most lethal attacker ever?Let's take a look at the legends leading their all-time goalscoring charts!

Updated: 10 Dec 2022, 10:44 PM IST AFP  Premium Cristiano Ronaldo reacts post Portugal's defeat againt Morocco at Quarter Final match during FIFA World Cup Qatar 2022 on 10 December. fname: .com sports content 10 interesting facts about the fifa world cup 2022
test: .com sports content 10 interesting facts about the fifa world cup 2022. 10 interesting facts about the FIFA World Cup 2022 | GQ India Skip to main contentSubscribeOpen Navigation MenuMenuStory SavedTo revisit this article, visit My Profile, then View saved storiesClose AlertLook GoodLive WellGet SmartEntertainmentMen of the YearBinge WatchVisual StoriesMSIVideoOpen Navigation MenuMenuStory SavedTo revisit this article, visit My Profile, then View saved storiesClose AlertSubscribeClose Navigation MenuLook GoodLive WellGet SmartEntertainmentMen of the YearBinge WatchVisual StoriesMSIVideoRelationshipsWeddingsMagazineGQ Style & Culture AwardsBest DressedFood and Drink FestivalGQ WardrobeThe Platinum ManFollow usFacebookTwitterInstagramYouTubeFlipboardSports10 interesting facts about the FIFA World Cup 2022Qatar 2022 is the most expensive FIFA World Cup ever6 December 2022The FIFA World Cup 2022 got underway in Qatar on 20 November. A total of 32 teams will be seen in action across a span of one month, with the final scheduled to be played on December 18. This is the first World Cup to be held in the Arab world, and the last to feature 32 teams. From the next edition in 2026, the number of participating teams will increase to 48. France is the defending champions, having defeated Croatia 4‚Äì2 in the 2018 final. Here are 10 interesting facts about the 2022 Qatar World Cup.1. The most expensive football World Cup everAs per Bloomberg, Qatar has spent a whopping $300 billion (Rs 2442000 crore) to organise the World Cup. As per Economic Times, the construction of new stadiums cost $6.5 billion (Rs 530 crore). In comparison, Russia had spent only $14.2 billion (Rs 115913 crore) to organise the 2018 World Cup, per Forbes.2. Shortest World CupThe Qatar World Cup will be played across 28 days, which makes it the shortest football World Cup since 1998. Since the World Cup became a 32-team tournament in 1998, the 2014 edition in Brazil was held over 32 days while the shortest 32-team World Cup was played across 31 days. The opening match of the 2022 World Cup was played on November 20, with the final to be held on December 18.3. Qatar‚Äôs World Cup debutAs the host country, Qatar‚Äôs national football team automatically qualified for the World Cup 2022. This is their first appearance at the FIFA World Cup. However, they lost their opening game to Ecuador.Here‚Äôs how much money the winners and runners-up of the FIFA World Cup 2022 will take homeBy Umaima Saeed4. The first FIFA World Cup to be played in winterThis is the first time that the football World Cup is being played in the months of November and December instead of May, June, or July. Summers in Qatar get harsh, which is why the tournament has been held in winter when the weather is pleasant. This, however, has played a spoilsport to the European league schedules.5. Youngest & oldest player in the tournament18-year-old Youssoufa Moukoko of Germany is the youngest player at the 2022 World Cup. At the Bundesliga in 2022, he helped Borussia Dortmund with three assists and six goals. The oldest player, meanwhile, is Egyptian goalkeeper Essam El-Hadary, aged 45.6. 1.5 million SpectatorsAs per The Hindu, more than 1.5 million people applied for the compulsory pass for the tournament. The pass serves as a visa, transport and match ticket and gives access to fan zones. The two international airports in Doha are prepared to handle 150,000 entries a day during the course of the tournament.¬† As per Bloomberg, nearly 3 million tickets had been sold by mid-October.¬†8 things that are banned at the FIFA World Cup 2022By Umaima Saeed7. Five billion viewershipAs per TOI, as many as five billion people are expected to tune in to watch the 2022 World Cup. That is more than half of the world‚Äôs population!8. Most title holdersThere are only eight teams in the world that have won the prestigious FIFA World Cup. Brazil has five wins, while Germany and Italy have four wins each. Uruguay, Argentina and France have two titles each, while Spain and England have one each. Six of these eight teams have won the trophy as a host ‚Äì England, Italy, Uruguay, Argentina, Germany and France.9. No beer, pride flags and holy booksQatar has banned the sale of alcohol at the Fifa World Cup 2022 stadiums. Beer will be available only in hospitality boxes and in fan zones after 7 pm. Pork-based items, balloons, loud music instruments, pride flags and cigarettes are also banned inside the stadiums.10. Last World Cup for Messi and Ronaldo?Argentina and Paris Saint-Germain icon Lionel Messi, 35, confirmed in October that Qatar 2022 will be his last, while Portugal and Manchester United player, 37-year-old Cristiano Ronaldo is yet to make a comment on his future in international football. Messi are Ronaldo are unarguably two of the greatest players to have played the game.Read more sports storiesMcLaren‚Äôs new first driver, Lando Norris, is coming in hotLionel Messi gifts gold iPhone 14 Pro to Argentina's World Cup-winning teammatesWomen‚Äôs Premier League: Check out the other most expensive picksAll you need to know about IPL 2023KeywordsDivert MeSportsFootball GQ RecommendsGet SmartCristiano Ronaldo is the highest-paid football player in the world, but he‚Äôs not the wealthiestBy Francesco BonfantiLook GoodThe expensive green watch worn by Cristiano Ronaldo recently has 710 precious stonesBy Hugo FizamesSportsHockey World Cup 2023 ‚Äì Everything you need to knowBy Umaima SaeedEntertainmentCristiano Ronaldo is paying a hefty Rs 2.5 Cr per month to stay at this lavish hotel suiteBy Umaima SaeedDrinkBest of 2022: 13 new & homegrown whisky bottles of the yearBy Saumyaa VohraEntertainmentWaltair Veerayya: Find out how many Crores Chiranjeevi & others chargedBy Gaurav SonavaneLook GoodIn the heart of Mumbai‚Äôs cultural hub is a bouquet of modern women's aestheticsBy Yoshita Rao FoodBest burgers in Delhi: 5 must-try joints in the city, according to food expertsBy Saumyaa VohraFacebookTwitterInstagramYouTubeFlipboardMore From GQ IndiaLook GoodLive WellGet SmartEntertainmentMen of the YearBinge WatchGQ WardrobeCond√© Nast IndiaADTravelerGQVogueAbout GQTerms of ServiceContactCareersAdvertisingNewsletterSubscriptionsDo Not Sell My Personal Info¬© 2023 Cond√© NastSelect international siteIndiaLargeChevronAustraliaBrasilBritainChinaEspa√±aFranceGermanyItaliaJapanKoreaM√©xicoMiddle EastPortugalSouth AfricaTaiwanThailandT√ºrkiyeUnited States

fname: istori.com 2022 12 2022 fifa world cup qatar stats goals records images.html
test: istori.com 2022 12 2022 fifa world cup qatar stats goals records images.html.      2022 FIFA World Cup Stats: Goals, Best v Worst, Records and More - Sportshistori       Search    Follow Us  Sitemap Index  Search     Home NFL _Super Bowl NBA _Basketball Tennis World Cup 2022 Golf Cricket Auto Racing Sports Money More _WWE _NHL _Rugby _Boxing _A-Z Sports   Menu Social       My Instagram   Search     HomeSoccer2022 FIFA World Cup Stats: Goals, Best v Worst, Records and More 2022 FIFA World Cup Stats: Goals, Best v Worst, Records and More sports history 9:46‚ÄØPM 0 Comments  FIFA World Cup 2022 Stats: Goals, Cards, Teams wins, losses, Best vs Worst in Qatar, Records, Images, Highlights and More     Argentina crowned the champions 2022 for the third time after beating France in a penalty shootout. Lionel Messi finally has his hands on the golden trophy that had long eluded him.   FIFA World Cup 2022 Result, Final Standings  Champions: Argentina (3rd title - 1978, 1986, 2022) Runners-Up: France 3rd Place: Croatia 4th Place: Morocco (Best Performance by an African nation)  FIFA World Cup 2022: Top Goal scorers, Most Assists  1. Kylian Mbappe France 8 2. Lionel Messi Argentina 7 3. Julian Alvarez Argentina 4 4. Olivier Giroud France 4 5. Alvaro Morata Spain 3* *Many other players who have 3 goal scores. FIFA World Cup 2022: Most Assists Five players in 2022 World Cup have finished with three assists to their name - Antoine Griezmann (France), Lionel Messi (Argentina), Bruno Fernandes (Portugal), Harry Kane (England), Ivan Perisic (Croatia) Players with the most goals and assists: Kylian Mbappe (France, 8 goals, 2 assists), Lionel Messi (Argentina, 7 goals, 3 assists).  FIFA World Cup 2022 Awards: Full List of winners in Qatar tournament.  Golden Boot: Top-Goal Scorer, Kylian Mbappe (France, 8 goals). Golden Ball: Player of the Year: Lionel Messi (Argentina). Young Player of the Year: Enzo Fernandez (Argentina). Golden Glove: Best Goalkeeper: Emiliano Martinez (Argentina). Fair-play award: England team.   FIFA World Cup 2022 Accurate Passes & Most Saved per 90 min games:  1. Rodri Spain 147.2 2. Aymeric Laporte Spain 123.0 3. Jordi Alba Spain 99.1 4. Pedri Spain 98.6 5. Leandro Paredes Argentina 92.0  Top 5 Playera of FIFA World Cup 2022 Saves per 90 min:  Player (Total Saves) Country Saves per 90 min  1. Wojciech Szczesny (23) Poland 5.8 2. Vanja Milinkovic-Savic (16) Serbia 5.3 3. Mohammed Al Owais (14) Saudi Arabia 4.7 4. Yann Sommer (12) Switzerland 4.0 5. Keylor Navas (11) Costa Rica 3.7  2022 FIFA World Cup Most Penalties in Qatar tournament:  A total of 23 penalties were awarded at an average of 0.36 per match - with 17 converted to goals - including three in the final - but that was actually down on the 2018 World Cup in Russia. Argentina were awarded the most number of penalties in the World Cup with 5. They were awarded a penalty each in the quarterfinal, semifinal and final.  How many Yellow Cards & Red Cards has been awarded in 2022 FIFA World Cup.?   Yellow Cards in 2022 World Cup in Qatar Overall Referees handed out 227 yellow cards - the most since 2010, the Total No. of Yellow Cards have been awarded so far to players in 2022 FIFA World Cup. So if we exclude the double or triple yellow card awarded player in the list, Total 206 Single Players have been given the Yellow Cards in Qatar tournament  List of red cards in FIFA World Cup 2022  There were Five red cards booked in this World Cup 2022. Here are the list of players & One for Korean Coach-  Wayne Hennessey - WALES vs Iran (violent conduct) Vincent Aboubakar - CAMEROON vs Brazil (second yellow) Denzel Dumfries - NETHERLANDS vs Argentina (second yellow) Walid Cheddira - MOROCCO vs Portugal (second yellow) Paulo Bento (coach) - SOUTH KOREA vs Ghana (dissent)  How many Total goals scored in Qatar 2022 FIFA World Cup.? Qatar 2022 World Cup sets a new record for most goals scored in Single world cup. A sensational World Cup 2022 has seen the Qatar tournament become the most prolific World Cup in history with a whopping 172 goals in 64 games with the average of 2.69 goals per game. Previous record, A total of 171 goals were scored in the 1998 and 2014 World Cups.   Who is the Youngest & Oldest Player in 2022 FIFA World Cup in Qatar.? World Cup 2022 Youngest Scorer: Gavi (Spain) at the age of 18 years 109 days against Costa Rica as Spain won 7-0.  World Cup 2022 Oldest Scorer: Pepe (Portugal) has scored in the Round of 16 match, at the age of 39 years 283 days, as the Portuguese cemented the Switzerlands 6-1. Oldest player to play: Atiba Hutchinson (Canada, 39 years 298 days) against Morocco. Youngest player to play: Youssoufa Moukoko (Germany, 18 years 3 days) in the match against Japan.  Which Teams has had the Most goals at the 2022 World Cup, Fewest goal scored teams in Qatar.? A total of 172 goals were goals scored in the 2022 edition of the World Cup.  France finished the tournament with the most goals as they netted 16 times. France - 16 Argentina - 15 England - 13 Portugal - 12 Netherlands - 10 Spain - 9 Brazil - 8 Belgium, Denmark, Qatar, Tunisia and Wales have scored the least number of goals, 1 each before drowning out in the group stage.  Team conceded the most: Costa Rica (11 goals).  The team to concede the least: Tunisia (1 goal).  Team with the best goal difference: England (+9).  The team with the worst goal difference: Costa Rica (-8).  Match with the most goals: England 6-2 Iran.  The match with the biggest difference: Spain 7-0 Costa Rica.  Which players made the Hat-Tricks in 2022 FIFA World Cup in Qatar.?  2 players scored hat-tricks in the tournament. Goncalo Ramos of Portugal against Switzerland and Kylian Mbappe (France) in the final against Argentina.  FIFA World Cup 2022 Most Appearance Record: Three players in this World Cup made their 5th different World Cup appearances -  Andres Guardado (Mexico), Cristiano Ronaldo (Portugal), and Lionel Messi (Argentina). Messi also has the record now of making the most appearances in World Cup, with 26 appearances.  The match with the most spectators: Argentina vs Mexico, Argentina vs Croatia, Argentina vs France, all took place at Lusail Stadium and had 88,966 spectators.   FIFA World Cup 2022: Teams Most wins, Losses, Draws.  The team with the most wins: France (5 matches).  The team with the fewest wins: Canada, Denmark, Qatar, Serbia, Wales (0 matches).  The team with the most defeats: Canada, Qatar (3 matches).  The team with the fewest losses (excluding penalties): Netherlands (0 matches).  Team with the most draws (excluding penalties): Croatia (4 matches).  The team with the fewest draws: Australia, Canada, Costa Rica, Ghana, Iran, Portugal, Qatar, Saudi Arabia, Senegal, Switzerland (0 matches).   Who is the Youngest & Oldest Coach in 2022 FIFA World Cup in Qatar.? The oldest coach in the tournament: Louis van Gaal (Netherlands), 71 years and 123 days in the quarter-final against Argentina. Youngest coach: Lionel Scaloni (Argentina), 44 years and 190 days in the opening match against Saudi Arabia.  FIFA World Cup 2022 Short Review: Best and worst of the tournament in Qatar  BEST PLAYER ‚Äî‚Äî Lionel Messi won the 2022 FIFA Golden Ball as the tournament‚Äôs best player, while scoring seven goals, providing three assists and being Argentina‚Äôs star player in all seven of its matches.  BIGGEST FLOP ‚Äî‚Äî  Portugal superstar Cristiano Ronaldo have had a worse tournament in his Entire Career. OK, he converted a penalty against Ghana to become the first man to score at five different World Cups, but nothing else went right for the player currently without a club. Ronaldo was benched against Switzerland and Morocco in the knockout stage due to bad attitude with his coach. BEST GOAL ‚Äî‚Äî Brazil striker Richarlison had his back to the goal when he used one touch to flick the ball up in the air near the penalty spot, as the Brazilean sealed a 2-0 win over Serbia in the group stage. BEST SAVE ‚Äî‚Äî There were 20 seconds remaining of stoppage time in extra time in the 2022 world cup final when French striker Randal Kolo Muani went clean through on Argentina goalkeeper Emi Martinez.   BEST MATCH ‚Äî‚Äî Argentina was involved in the best two. First, the team‚Äôs quarterfinal match against the Netherlands had it all ‚Äî late drama through a goal in the 11th minute of stoppage time to make it 2-2, a penalty shootout, a World Cup-record 17 yellow cards and a red card after the whistle. THEN, At the END, came the " Battle of Lusail" happened in World Cup Fina, which might have just topped it.  MOST DISAPPOINTING TEAM ‚Äî‚Äî Belgium entered as the second-ranked team and with some of the most famous players in the world. They scored Just one goal, didn‚Äôt get out of their group ‚Äî‚Äî Germany exiting from the group stage for the second straight World Cup is a close second. BEST FANS ‚Äî‚Äî Morocco‚Äôs for the noise, Argentina‚Äôs for the pure passion, and Japan‚Äôs for the way they tidy up after themselves.  BEST QUOTE ‚Äî‚Äî ‚ÄúI had the feeling that this was the one.‚Äù ‚Äî Lionel Messi after winning the World Cup for the first time. ___ The FIFA World Cup Stunning Images: Remarkable Best Photos from Qatar 2022 tournament. If two or more players score the same number of goals, the number of assists (as determined by the members of the FIFA Technical Study Group) shall be decisive. If two or more players are still equal after taking into account the number of assists, the total minutes played in the tournament will be taken into account, with the player playing fewer minutes ranked first. A Silver Boot and a Bronze Boot will also be awarded for the second and third-highest goalscorers, respectively. fname: com football kylian mbappe becomes second player to score hattrick in fifa world cup final 204785.html
test: com football kylian mbappe becomes second player to score hattrick in fifa world cup final 204785.html.  Kylian Mbappe becomes second player to score hattrick in FIFA World Cup final By Mark Hoover Published: Monday, December 19, 2022, 1:00 [IST] Lusail, December 19: Kylian Mbappe on Sunday (December 18) became the second player ever to score a hattrick in the FIFA World Cup Final, but the Frenchman could not help his nation win a second World Cup in a row. The treble also made the 23-year-old Frenchman the second player and the first since England's Geoff Hurst scored a hattrick against West Germany in the 1966 World Cup Final. by TaboolaSponsored Links Born With A Heart Condition, Sopiga Needs Surgery To Live. Ketto Learn More Belly Fat Removal Without Surgery in Cherthala: The Price Might Surprise You Laser Liposuction | Sponsored Results The hattrick helped Mbappe clinch the World Cup Golden Boot, but his efforts went in vain as Lionel Messi's Argentina triumphed on penalties. FIFA World Cup 2022: Full List of Award Winners, Golden Boot, Golden Ball, Golden Glove, Prize Money and Stats Mbappe entered Sunday's game level with Paris Saint-Germain team-mate Messi on five goals, and twice fell behind in his battle with the Argentina captain in a thrilling contest. How Mbappe Hattrick Came About Messi became the first player to reach 20 World Cup goal involvements when he opened the scoring from the spot following Ousmane Dembele's trip on Angel Di Maria, who then capped a flowing move to put Argentina 2-0 up heading into half time. However, Mbappe was gifted a route back into the battle atop the goalscoring charts with 10 minutes remaining, tucking a penalty home after Nicolas Otamendi fouled Randal Kolo Muani. Mbappe then moved clear in the race for the Golden Boot in incredible fashion 97 seconds later, lashing a first-time volley beyond Emiliano Martinez to force extra time via his second goal. Messi looked to have sealed the award - and the trophy for his country - once again when he prodded Argentina back in front in extra time, but Mbappe responded with yet another spot-kick when Gonzalo Montiel was penalised for handball. But all that went in vain in the shootout, which Argentina sealed 4-2. Mbappe FIFA World Cup Final Most Goals Records Having netted in 2018's win against Croatia, Mbappe is now the highest-scoring player in World Cup final history with four, while his overall tally of 12 goals at the tournament puts him level with three-time champion Pele. Mbappe's total of eight goals in Qatar is the joint highest at a single World Cup since Gerd Muller scored 10 times in 1970 (also Ronaldo, eight in 2002), but that will come as little consolation to the forward following France's painful defeat. Mbappe also became the youngest player to reach double figures at the finals - aged 23 years 363 days - surpassing Muller's record (24 years, 226 days). fname: m fifaplus en articles enzo fernandez the rapid rise of argentinas award winning youngster
test: m fifaplus en articles enzo fernandez the rapid rise of argentinas award winning youngster. Enzo Fernandez: The rapid rise of Argentina's award-winning youngster We look at how the Argentina midfielder came from nowhere to win the FIFA Young Player award at Qatar 2022. Enzo Fernandez: A midfield maestro with a warrior's heart Learn how the Argentina star developed into the player and man he is today from his former youth coach at River Plate. Enzo Fernandez received the FIFA Young Player award at Qatar 2022 The Argentina midfielder was a key man throughout the knockout phase Rising star has described playing with Lionel Messi as ìa dream come trueî A modest, almost bashful smile came over Enzo Fernandezís face as he climbed the podium to receive the Qatar 2022 FIFA Young Player award. Collecting the prize meant the dynamic midfielder was momentarily separated from his jubilant team-mates, celebrating wildly at the side of the presentation stage following the greatest World Cup final of them all. As the scene unfolded, Fernandez could be forgiven for having a look of slight disbelief in his eyes. The 21-year-oldís story is among the most remarkable from this unforgettable World Cup. FIFA World Cupô? 2022 Best Young Player: Enzo Fernandez Argentina's Enzo Fernandez is handed the trophy for the Best Young Player at the 2022 FIFA World Cupô? in Qatar. Fernandez only made his senior international debut in September, coming on as a second-half substitute in a 3-0 friendly win over Honduras. The occasion saw Fernandez fulfil a lifelong ambition to play alongside his idol, Lionel Messi. ìTo play with Leo brings me enormous joy,î said Fernandez, in the aftermath of that game. ìItís a dream come true.î Less than three months later and Messi would be describing Fernandez as a ìspectacular kidî, with the pair instrumental figures in Argentinaís world-champion side. Fernandez secured his place in Lionel Scaloniís Qatar 2022 squad following further mature displays in two pre-tournament friendlies ñ and having continued to excel for club side Benfica. His rare combination of boundless energy, immaculate technique and tactical intelligence has seen him swiftly acclimatise to European football following his move from boyhood club River Plate this summer. He has been a near ever-present for a Benfica side which has swept all before them at home and abroad this season. The team remain unbeaten across 28 matches in all competitions and finished top of a UEFA Champions League group featuring Messiís Paris Saint-Germain. At just 21, Fernandezís capacity to dictate the tempo of the game marks him out as a special talent. The youngster's passing is crisp, incisive and precise ñ his accuracy rate is 90 per cent in league matches this term and was 88 per cent during the World Cup. His ability to contribute in the final third, meanwhile, is underlined by the five assists and three goals he has already racked up for Benfica. Argentina v Mexico | Group C | FIFA World Cup Qatar 2022ô | Highlights Watch the highlights from the match between Argentina and Mexico played at Lusail Stadium, Lusail on Saturday, 26 November 2022. Fernandezís ball-striking ability, of course, was memorably displayed in Argentinaís do-or-die group-stage win over Mexico, when he expertly curled a shot into the top corner of Guillermo Ochoaís net to seal a 2-0 victory. He had come on as a substitute in that game but would start every remaining match of Argentinaís triumphant World Cup campaign. His introduction into coach Scaloniís line-up coincided with Argentina steadily growing in stature and belief. Dovetailing impressively with midfield colleagues Alexis Mac Allister and Rodrigo De Paul, Fernandezís tigerish tackling and competitive spirit added intensity to La Albicelesteís performances. Indeed, his total of 22 successful tackles was surpassed by only two players across the World Cup (Mateo Kovacic and Achraf Hakimi). Fernandez was at his all-action best in the showpiece final as Argentina overwhelmed France in the opening 70 minutes of the contest. Kylian Mbappe would then turn the game on its head as the match developed into an all-time classic, but Fernandezís Argentina dug deep into their reserves of resilience and determination to eventually triumph in the most dramatic circumstances. Argentina v France | Final | FIFA World Cup Qatar 2022ô | Highlights Watch the highlights from the match between Argentina and France played at Lusail Stadium, Lusail on Sunday, 18 December 2022. The midfielderís significant influence on this Argentina team is highlighted by the fact he was one of only five members of Scaloniís side to play the full 120 minutes of the final. Moments after receiving his richly deserved FIFA Young Player award, Fernandezís sheepish smile transformed into one of unbridled joy as he re-joined his team-mates for the World Cup presentation. Six years previously, Fernandez penned an open letter on Facebook to the man about to hoist that trophy high into the sky, urging his hero to reconsider retirement from international football. ìPlease donít go, Leo,î he wrote. ìSeeing you play with the light blue and white is the greatest pride in the world. Stay and have fun.î Thankfully, for Enzo ñ for every football lover ñ Lionel Messi did just that, going on to win the greatest prize of all. And with the help of a young midfielder with the world at his feet.
